VarArray var_array

Detailed Description

template<typename VarArray>
struct NeqConstraint< VarArray >

constraints;alldiff Description Forces the input vector of variables to take distinct values. constraints;alldiff Example Suppose the input file had the following vector of variables defined:

DISCRETE myVec[9] {1..9}

To ensure that each variable takes a different value include the following constraint:

alldiff(myVec) constraints;alldiff Notes Enforces the same level of consistency as a clique of not equals constraints. constraints;alldiff References See

help constraints gacalldiff

for the same constraint that enforces GAC.

template<typename VarArray>
virtual triggerCollection NeqConstraint< VarArray >::setup_internal (  )  [inline, virtual]

Gets all the triggers a constraint wants to set up.

This function shouldn't do any propagation. That is full_propagate's job.

virtual BOOL NeqConstraint< VarArray >::full_check_unsat (  )  [inline, virtual]

Checks if a constraint cannot be satisfied, and sets up any data structures for future incremental checks. Returns TRUE if constraint cannot be satisfied. This function is used by rarification

Definition at line 170 of file constraint_neq.h.

Referenced by NeqConstraint< VarArray >::get_satisfying_assignment().

template<typename VarArray>
virtual bool NeqConstraint< VarArray >::get_satisfying_assignment ( box< pair< int, DomainInt > > &  assignment  )  [inline, virtual]

Looks for a valid partial assignment to a constraint.

The return value (in the box) is pairs of <varnum, domain value>, where varnum is in the same position as returned by get_vars.
